column5: I'm heading there next week myself. Are there any leeches to be had in the Sioux Lookout area? I understand they are very scarce.
Any one been to Lake Minnitaki lately that has any fishing reports to offer?
Any one been to Lake Minnitaki lately that has any fishing reports to offer?
Fishing is great lots of 28in eyes this year.

Friends returned saturday after a week long trip-they said mon, tues, and wed it was 50 degrees. 7 guys fished all who have been fishing this lake for more than 10 years and some 20 they caught 71 eyes...worse year they have ever had. TB

>Friends returned saturday after a week long trip-they said >mon, tues, and wed it was 50 degrees. 7 guys fished all who >have been fishing this lake for more than 10 years and some 20 >they caught 71 eyes...worse year they have ever had. TB Thanks for the info I thought last year was bad I guess we will have our work cut out for us.

Fished it in June and picked up a few hundred. not as many in the slot this year as years past but more above the slot than normal. spring thaw was very early so fishing was deep and slow but once you adjusted all was good. I am up here this week with the kids and we went out today on Pelican and caught about 30. mostly small but more than enough to eat. again deep and slow. 20 feet of water, 1/4 oz heads, within 4 inches of the bottom. around moving water or humps seemed best.
Thanks we leave to come up on the 19th I will report how we do then.

We were there 9-15 July and had one of our best years. Fished in the English River with jigs and minnows and got lots of small walleyes. Then trolled crankbaits mostly and got bigger fish, about even numbers of walleyes and northerns. Best action was in Redpine Bay. Others in camp did well trolling Lindy rigs and spinner rigs. Did not have much success jiggin deep on humps, although we did get our best walleye that way.

Any new reports? Headed up to Pickerel Arm Camp this weekend. Thanks, --Jeff
